      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(int width,
              int height,
              boolean ones)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a matrix optionally filled with ones
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the matrix
        height - Height of the matrix
        ones - Whether or not to fill the matrix with ones only; else fill it with zeroes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(double[] input,
              int width,
              int height)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new matrix from a 1D array given a certain width and height. First fill the rows, then the columns
        Parameters:
        input - Array containing data to fill the matrix with
        width - Width of the matrix
        height - Height of the matrix
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(int width,
              int height,
              double min,
              double max)
        Create and fill a matrix with random variables bounded by min and max
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the matrix
        height - Height of the matrix
        min - Minimum random value to occur in the matrix
        max - Maximum random value to occur in the matrix

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts matrix to a String. See example below: 
        
 ┌                                ┐
 │ -1,00 -1,92 -1,80 -0,92  0,25  │
 │  0,05  0,99  0,25 -0,50 -0,19  │
 │  0,98 -1,94 -1,35  0,22 -0,88  │
 │ -0,85 -1,63  0,07 -0,39 -0,24  │
 │  0,45 -0,33 -1,14  0,07 -0,61  │
 └                                ┘
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
